priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Cell State Response Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C181172

self.title: CDISC SDTM Cell State Response Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the values that describe the subset of the cell population based on a particular functional and/or biological state.
name: Cell State Response
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Cell State Response Terminology

terms.definition: Pertaining to the state of being activated, in which a characteristic function or property has been induced to occur.
Pertaining to the state of being apoptotic, in which programmed cell death is occurring.
Pertaining to the state of being exhausted, in which the entity is functionally inept and incapable of exhibiting the usual array of activities.
Pertaining to the state of non-proliferation, in which the entity is not actively multiplying or increasing in number.
Pertaining to the state of being non-viable, in which the entity is not capable of life or normal growth and development.
Pertaining to the state of proliferation, in which the entity is actively multiplying or increasing in number.
Pertaining to the state of being senescent, in which there is irreversible cell-cycle and/or functional arrest related to cell aging or disease.
Pertaining to the state of being viable, in which the entity is capable of life or normal growth and development.
